name: Grange Barn and Paycocke's House Circular Walk, Grange Barn

ai.summary: A scenic 7.9 km circular walk starting at Grange Barn, looping past Paycocke's House in Coggeshall, Essex. The route combines gentle ridges, rural lanes, hedgerows and historic sights with countryside views.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail uses a mix of well-trodden paths, grassy tracks and quiet country lanes. Expect short ascents along gentle ridges, some gates and stiles, and uneven surfaces with possible mud in wet weather. Open fields can be exposed; provide sun or rain protection as needed.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and wear sturdy footwear. Stay on the waymarked paths and be mindful of traffic on narrow lanes. Gates and stiles may need hand use; watch for livestock and farm machines. Carry water, a map or GPS, a small first-aid kit, and a charged phone. Insects and ticks are common in summer; keep dogs under control. Plan for daylight hours and have a backup plan in case of poor conditions.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate clothing (layers with a waterproof jacket)
Headlamp or flashlight (if walking near dusk)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly Marchâ€“October) offer the best conditions with milder weather and longer daylight. Summer can be warm and busy; winter walks may be muddy and slippery.

seo.title: Grange Barn and Paycocke's House Circular Walk - 7.9 km Ridge Route in Essex, UK
seo.meta_description: Explore a 7.9 km circular hike around Grange Barn and Paycocke's House in Coggeshall, Essex. Enjoy rural ridges, historic sights, and classic English countryside.
